title: Is childhood obesity caused by inactivity? - Quora

response.answer_text: Obesity begins with overfeeding from infancy, it creates fat cells, those fat cells stay for life, according to Dr. Rand they don’t multiply they expand. It also expands the infants stomach allowing for more food intake. Inactivity suggests a slow metabolism, the child would be unenergetic lazing around, eating, not getting outside exercise and expanding his fat cells. I know an obese young lady weighing in at the 400 lb. mark, I watched her grow-up from the age of 3 she was an obese 3 year old. I mentioned to her mother she overfed her kid from infancy, she didn’t disagree. Young mothers mean well for their children, they just don’t know over-bottle feeding will result in obesity. Thank you Joshua, good day to you. Donna Thompson

Inactivity certainly contributes, but childhood obesity is caused by overfeeding. If a child is fed too much food, especially food that is very high in calories, they will become overweight, and eventually obese.
